query.description: ** REQUIRED ** The unique identifier of the camera.
The timestamp of the footage on a specified camera. Formatted as a Unix timestamp in seconds. If no timestamp is specified, a live link will be returned
** REQUIRED ** The unique identifier of the camera.

The approximate timestamp of the requested thumbnail. Formatted as a Unix timestamp in seconds.
Defaults to the current time.
An enumeration.  "low-res" or "hi-res".  Default: "low-res"
** REQUIRED ** The unique identifier of the camera.
The timestamp when thumbnail was captured. Formatted as a Unix timestamp in seconds. Defaults to the current time.
The expiry duration for the generated link. Formatted as a Unix timestamp in seconds. Defaults to one day.

The expiration time duration, in seconds from the current timestamp, for which the JWT remains valid. The maximum allowable value is 3600 seconds. Once a token has expired, it is no longer functional for streaming footage.
** REQUIRED ** The unique identifier of the organization.
** REQUIRED ** The unique identifier of the camera.

The start time of the video stream on a specified camera. Formatted as epoch time in seconds. For live footage stream, set to 0. For history footage stream, start_time - end_time should be less than or equal to 3600. Default: 0

The end time of the video stream on a specified camera. Formatted as epoch time in seconds. For live footage stream, set to 0. For history footage stream, start_time - end_time should be less than or equal to 3600. Default: 0

The resolution of the video stream. For live video stream, set to high_res for the high resolution stream, and set to low_res for the low resolution stream. For history video streaming, set to high_res for a mix of low and high resolution video stream with high resolution footage prioritized when available and set to low_res for only low resolution footage. Default: low_res
The video type. This parameter is reserved for solely future compatibility. Set to stream. Default: stream
A short lived token that will be used to verify the permission to stream live or history footage from the camera. This can be acquired with the Get Streaming Token endpoint.
The codec used for the video stream. Default: hevc
** REQUIRED ** The unique identifier of the camera.
An enumeration.  "low-res" or "hi-res".  Default: "low-res"
